channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Israeli strikes in northern Gaza leave 87 dead or missing: Gaza health ministry
item.description: Israeli airstrikes in northern Gaza resulted in at least 87 casualties, with additional injuries in Beit Lahiya. Israel's military continues operations targeting Hamas militants. The conflict has severely impacted Gaza's northern region, displacing many residents. Concurrently, the US is probing leaked documents on Israel's potential response plans to Iran's missile attack.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Yahya Sinwar's wife seen carrying $32,000 handbag in tunnel escape footage: IDF
item.description: IDF claims that former Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar's wife, Samar Muhammad Abu Zamar, was seen with a $32,000 Hermès Birkin handbag as they fled into a tunnel before the October 7 attack on Israel. Lieutenant Colonel Avichay Adraee highlighted the wealth disparity between Sinwar's family and ordinary Gazan citizens. Sinwar was killed by Israeli forces in Gaza on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel escalates Beirut bombing, kill 73 in Gaza strike, 70 projectiles cross from Lebanon within minutes: Top developments
item.description: Israeli military strikes targeted Hezbollah centers in Beirut amid escalating tensions. The attack hit intelligence headquarters and weapons facilities, with additional clashes reported in southern Lebanon. Simultaneously, the Gaza offensive resulted in significant casualties. Prime Minister Netanyahu accused Hezbollah of an assassination attempt, intensifying the conflict. Classified US documents revealing Israel’s military strategies were also leaked.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Chinese food delivery industry faces downturn, workers' earnings drop by 1,000 yuan
item.description: China's USD 200 billion food delivery industry, which thrived during the pandemic, faces a downturn due to economic challenges. Delivery workers are seeing reduced incomes and job stability as consumer spending weakens. Workers now earn less despite longer hours and face increased risks from tight delivery deadlines, making it difficult to sustain livelihoods.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia destroys 110 Ukraine drones, four fighters injured in Dzerzhinsk
item.description: Four firefighters sustained minor shrapnel injuries after a Ukrainian drone attacked an industrial area in Dzerzhinsk, Russia. The incident was part of a broader assault where Russian air defense intercepted 110 drones, including in Moscow and other western regions, causing temporary fires and disruptions. Kyiv has previously said that its air attacks focus on infrastructure vital to Russia's war efforts in response to ongoing airstrikes on Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Do you think Trump ever changed a tire?': Obama mocks Trump at Nevada rally
item.description: Barack Obama endorsed Kamala Harris and Minnesota Governor Tim Walz in Las Vegas, highlighting their leadership and partnership potential. Praising Walz's background and bipartisan efforts, Obama compared his abilities with Trump in a humorous light, emphasizing Harris and Walz's focus on addressing real issues and improving citizens' lives over personal concerns.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Leaked US documents reveal Israel’s plans for strike on Iran
item.description: The US government is investigating the leak of classified documents detailing Israel’s military actions against Iran. Originating from GEOINT and NSA, these Top Secret documents were shared online, prompting a probe into the breach and concerns over further sensitive information exposure.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prabowo Subianto takes oath as eighth president of Indonesia
item.description: Prabowo Subianto, sworn in as Indonesia's eighth president on Sunday, took his oath on the Quran in Jakarta. The ceremony saw attendance from global leaders and supporters. Subianto, a former defense minister and rival to ex-President Widodo, promises continuity of existing policies. He has previously faced allegations of human rights abuses during Indonesia’s military dictatorship.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: New literary treasure: Lost ghost story by 'Dracula' author Bram Stoker discovered in Dublin
item.description: A forgotten story by Dracula author Bram Stoker, titled 'Gibbet Hill', has been unearthed in Dublin by historian Brian Cleary. Hidden for over 130 years, the story is now being publicly displayed, enriching Stoker's literary legacy and offering insight into his early works.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: In Israeli footage of the last minutes of Hamas leader's life, some see a symbol of defiance
item.description: The final moments of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, captured in drone footage, show divergent reactions. In Gaza, some mourned or hoped for war's end, while across the Arab and Muslim world, he was seen as a heroic martyr. Israelis celebrated his demise, but critics argue that his death ignites further defiance among Palestinians.

item.title: 'We have power to change this moment': Usher endorses Harris; MAGA calls out singer's links to Diddy
item.description: Usher endorsed Kamala Harris for U.S. President at a rally in Atlanta. He highlighted her commitment to inclusivity and urged voter turnout in Georgia. Usher followed singer Lizzo, who had previously joined Harris' campaign. Some people criticized Usher for his alleged ties to controversial events, but his endorsement generated significant enthusiasm among Harris' supporters.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: G7 defence ministers concerned by attacks on peacekeepers, vow Kyiv support
item.description: G7 defence ministers met in Naples amid multiple conflicts, expressing concern over Lebanon's situation and pledging unwavering support for Ukraine. The ministers emphasised continued military assistance to Ukraine and called for Iran to stop supporting Hamas and Hezbollah. There were also discussions on strengthening the UN peacekeeping mission in Lebanon and the impact of global instability.

item.title: Taiwan detects six aircraft, seven vessels near its territory
item.description: Taiwan's Ministry of National Defence detected six Chinese military aircraft and seven naval vessels near its territory, with two aircraft crossing the median line into Taiwan's southwestern ADIZ. Taiwan's President Lai Ching-te reassured the public of the government's dedication to defending the island's democracy in light of China's large-scale military exercises, which aim to intimidate and disrupt regional peace.

item.title: Ferry dock collapses in Georgia; seven dead
item.description: At least seven people died when a ferry dock collapsed during Gullah-Geechee cultural celebrations on Sapelo Island, Georgia. The incident involved a boat striking the dock, causing several individuals to fall into the water. Authorities are continuing search operations and investigations. Georgia governor Brian Kemp expressed sorrow and urged prayers for the victims and their families.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Just too easy to hack’: Elon Musk claims voting machines rig elections, calls for paper ballots
item.description: Elon Musk, during a Pennsylvania town hall, linked Dominion Voting Systems to alleged election rigging in Philadelphia and Arizona, advocating for paper ballots. Dominion countered, clarifying their non-operation in Philadelphia and emphasizing their system's accuracy through audits. Musk's remarks have intensified election security debates ahead of the 2024 campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China: President Xi directs PLA rocket force to strengthen deterrence and combat capabilities
item.description: China's President Xi Jinping inspected a brigade of the People's Liberation Army Rocket Force, emphasizing the need to enhance deterrence and combat capabilities. Xi urged the troops to strengthen targeted training with new equipment and methods, reinforcing the Party's absolute leadership. Meanwhile, Taiwan reported increased Chinese military activities near its territory.

item.title: King Charles makes his first public appearance during Australia tour
item.description: King Charles III made his first public appearance in Sydney since his cancer diagnosis. His 9-day Australia tour includes addressing the New South Wales parliament and private meetings. Due to his health, large gatherings are limited. A group of protesters near a church called for Australia to 'decolonise,' reflecting mixed feelings about the monarchy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pro-Liberation writers’ group attacked in Dhaka
item.description: Around 100 people attacked the Creative Writers Association during a protest in Dhaka after the cancellation of March 7 and August 15 as national days. The mob assaulted the protesters, identifying them with the Awami League, and chased them away. The Liberal Democratic Party called for banning the Awami League.

item.title: Fresh trouble for Harry Meghan? Locals of Portugal's Comporta don't want Royals to settle there
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan face local backlash in Portugal for purchasing a holiday home, with residents upset over wealthy property owners restricting beach access. UK Express reported that restricting access to public beaches was illegal in Portugal until recently but new regulations now allow local councils and government agencies to designate certain beaches as "private".
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Diddy was obsessed with Prince Harry, William because...' reveals ex-aide
item.description: Amid speculations over the princes' connection with the disgraced singer, Rob Shuter said Diddy's obsession with the princes was natural because he used to think himself as the king. "He thinks of himself as a king, so it makes perfect sense that he would like to have two princes in his entourage," Shuter said confirming that William and Harry never accepted Diddy's offer to join him.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
